page.title: 12FRADDAM
page.content: The densest area of population is the hamlet of Fraddam which had many more cottages during the early part of the century, its last shop closing 7 years ago. The pub remains structurally unaltered but modernised inside. The thatched cottage opposite the pub burned down in about 1930. A bungalow was built on the site and now several acres of glass constitute a very fine nursery.Fraddam has had 2 garages for many years. Originally one was a bus company having a bus with a lorry body for haulage on weekends and a bus body for Saturdays. Most of the residents were miners and quarry men. When mining ended the area became derilict until it was developed into a landscaped campsite. In recent years various mining companies have shown interest in tin exploration.
